text.0: thou agni even as mitra hast a princely glory of thine own.
text.1: thou active vasu makest fame increase like full prosperity.
text.2: for verily men pray to thee with sacrifices and with songs.
text.3: to thee the friendly courser seen of all comes speeding through the air.
text.4: of one accord men kindle thee heavens signal of the sacrifice.
text.5: when craving bliss this race of man invites thee to the solemn rite.
text.6: let the man thrive who travails sore in prayer far thee the bountiful.
text.7: he with the help of lofty dyaus comes safe through straits of enmity.
text.8: the mortal who with fuel lights thy flame and offers unto thee.
text.9: supports a house with many a branch agni to live a hundred years.
text.10: thy bright smoke lifts itself aloft and farextended shines in heaven.
text.11: for purifier like the sun thou beamest with thy radiant glow.
text.12: for in mens houses thou must be glorified as a wellloved guest.
text.13: gay like an elder in a fort claiming protection like a son.
text.14: thou agni like an able steed art urged by wisdom in the wood.
text.15: thou art like wind food home art thou like a young horse that runs astray.
text.16: een things imperishable thou o agni like a gazing ox.
text.17: eatest when hosts eternal one of thee the mighty rend the woods.
text.18: agni thou enterest as priest the home of men who sacrifice.
text.19: lord of the people prosper them accept the ofrering aṅgiras.
text.20: o agni god with mitras might call hither the favour of the gods from earth and heaven.
text.21: bring weal from heaven that men may dwell securely may we oercome the foes malign oppressions may we oercome them through thy help oercome them.
